revised_title: X-ray Bragg Reflexion from Perfect Crystals: Dependence on Geometrical Factors
tldr: The article explores the variation of X-ray Bragg reflexion properties in perfect crystals based on geometrical factors such as thickness and degree of asymmetry. The study uses direct numerical evaluation of the dynamical theory to demonstrate the zero-level-of-interaction limit for both finite and infinite-thickness perfect crystals. The findings reveal that integrated reflectivity can exceed that of the corresponding semi-infinite crystal and can even surpass that of an ideally mosaic crystal in certain cases, leading to the phenomenon of negative extinction.
